ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Gender identity: Do you identify as:
Notes: 1 = Female; 2 = Male; 3 = Other; 4 = Agender; 5 = Nonbinary/Fluid; 6 = Transgender female; 7 = Transgender male; 8 = Genderqueer; 9 = Do not wish to report; 10 = Multiple Identities Listed; 11 = Non-binary; 12 = Genderfluid

ElementDescription: Race of study subject
ValueRange: American Indian/Alaska Native; Asian; Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; Black or African American; White; More than one race; Unknown or not reported; Other Non-White; Other

ElementDescription: Race of Respondent Specify
How long have you lived in this county?
How long have you lived in this county? (option for months or years)
Is this city/town considered as an urbanized area? (Has a population of 50,000 people or more)?
Unfortunately, at this time we can only conduct the study in English. Do you speak and understand English fluently?

Now I would like to ask you some questions about your use of alcoholic drinks like beer; wine; wine coolers; champagne; or hard liquor like vodka; gin; or whiskey. When I use the term drink; I mean a glass of wine; a can or bottle of beer, or a shot of liquor alone or in a mixed drink. Have you ever had a drink of alcohol?
In the past month (30 days), have you consumed a whole drink of alcohol
In the past month (30 days) have you ever consumed at least 5 or more drinks in a row, that is, within a couple of hours?
In the past month, have you had enough alcohol drinks to feel intoxicated or drunk?
Have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes in your entire life?  (Note to interviewer: 100 CIGARETTES = APPROXIMATELY 5 PACKS) PX030602_Cigarette_Smoking_100
Do you now smoke cigarettes?
Notes: 1 = Everyday ; 2 = Smoke Days ; 3 = Not At All

ElementDescription: Do you have access to reliable internet?
Do you have the ability to access the video chat platforms such as Zoom or Skype?
How did you hear about this study?

How did you hear about this study?: flyer (please specify where you saw or got the flyer, if you remember)
